thread.title: Minnesota United to build stadium in St. Paul
thread.title_full: Minnesota United to build stadium in St. Paul

author: Monster storm makes landfall as category 5 in Mexico
title: Minnesota United to build stadium in St. Paul
text:
Minnesota United to build stadium in St. Paul Goal.com 17 hrs ago © Provided by Goal.com Minnesota United will call St. Paul home when it joins Major League Soccer.
AdChoices William McGuire, the owner of the team, and Chris Coleman, mayor of St. Paul announced Friday that they are working together to put a stadium with a capacity near 20,000 on the Snelling-Midway site. That site currently sits vacant and is owned by the Metropolitan Council, according to the Pioneer Press.
“Today we are one step closer toward the debut of Major League Soccer in Minnesota,” MLS Commissioner Don Garber said in a statement. “We believe the Midway location will be a tremendous home for Minnesota’s new MLS club based on the site’s central location, close proximity to a diverse millennial population, and easy access to multiple modes of public transportation.”
McGuire has promised the team will foot the bill for all building costs for the stadium and said Friday that this location would fufill the needs of fans throughout the region.
"By all measures important to soccer fans throughout the Twin Cities metro and the state, as well as the needs of the team and Major League Soccer, this is a great location for an iconic soccer facility that will house the MLS franchise in Minnesota," he said in a statement.
